Transfers both the compensation and the user remaining stake.","params":{"_tokenAddress":"1. address of the token to claim compensation"}},"addAllowedTokens(address)":{"details":"add a token to ve allowed for staking","params":{"_tokenAddress":"1. address of the new allowed token"}},"constructor":{"params":{"_burnRate":"3. (_burnRate/1000)% of DSLA to be burned after a reward/compensation is paid","_dslaTokenAddress":"1. address of the base token","_minimumDSLAStakedTier1":"4. minimum stake of DSLA to enable tier 1 privileges","_minimumDSLAStakedTier2":"5. minimum stake of DSLA to enable tier 2 privileges","_minimumDSLAStakedTier3":"6. minimum stake of DSLA to enable tier 3 privileges","_providerRewardPercentage":"2. percentage of the users pool to be rewarded to the provider"}},"getStakeholdersStakes(address)":{"details":"gets the positions of stake both for provider and for users","params":{"_tokenAddress":"1. token address to get the positions"},"returns":{"providerStake":"position of the provider (owner) of the SLA contract","usersStake":"position of the user of the SLA contract"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. documentation.text: @dev SLARegistry contract
@dev (tokenAddress=>uint256) total pooled token balance
@dev (tokenAddress=>stakerAddress=>uint256) staker position to represent his proportion staked
@dev (tokenAddress=>uint256) used to keep track of the stakes of the users, to calculate proportion of compensation pool
@dev (tokenAddress=>uint256) provider available reward per token
@dev (tokenAddress=>uint256) users available compensation per token
@dev (periodId=>tokenAddress=>uint256) provider compensation per period and per token
@dev address[] of the stakers of the SLA contract
@dev DSLA token address to burn fees
@dev array with the allowed tokens addresses of the StakeRegistry
@dev corresponds to the reward percentage to be paid to the provider after a respected period
@dev corresponds to the burn rate of DSLA tokens, but divided by 1000 i.e burn percentage = burnRate/1000 %
@dev minimum deposit for Tier 1 staking
@dev minimum deposit for Tier 2 staking
@dev minimum deposit for Tier 3 staking

_claimCompensation(address).details: claim user compensation. Transfers both the compensation and the user remaining stake.

params._tokenAddress: 1. address of the token to claim compensation

addAllowedTokens(address).details: add a token to ve allowed for staking

params._tokenAddress: 1. address of the new allowed token

params._burnRate: 3. (_burnRate/1000)% of DSLA to be burned after a reward/compensation is paid
params._minimumDSLAStakedTier1: 4. minimum stake of DSLA to enable tier 1 privileges
params._minimumDSLAStakedTier2: 5. minimum stake of DSLA to enable tier 2 privileges
params._minimumDSLAStakedTier3: 6. minimum stake of DSLA to enable tier 3 privileges
params._providerRewardPercentage: 2. percentage of the users pool to be rewarded to the provider

getStakeholdersStakes(address).details: gets the positions of stake both for provider and for users

params._tokenAddress: 1. token address to get the positions

returns.providerStake: position of the provider (owner) of the SLA contract
returns.usersStake: position of the user of the SLA contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

allowedTokens.details: array with the allowed tokens addresses of the StakeRegistry

burnRate.details: corresponds to the burn rate of DSLA tokens, but divided by 1000 i.e burn percentage = burnRate/1000 %

dslaTokenAddress.details: DSLA token address to burn fees

providerPeriodsRewards.details: (periodId=>tokenAddress=>uint256) provider compensation per period and per token

providerRewardPercentage.details: corresponds to the reward percentage to be paid to the provider after a respected period

stakeHoldersPositions.details: (tokenAddress=>stakerAddress=>uint256) staker position to represent his proportion staked

stakers.details: address[] of the stakers of the SLA contract

usersTotalPositions.details: (tokenAddress=>uint256) used to keep track of the stakes of the users, to calculate proportion of compensation pool

_claimCompensation(address).notice: it uses the user position and the user total position per token to check the proportion of the compensation pool that corresponds to every user
